intro: Astragalus eupeplus, commonly known as the plains milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in arid conditions. Astragalus eupeplus is also valued for its role in soil stabilization and as a forage plant for wildlife.
